comment: I think his rating is kind of low because of his teaching style, but I really enjoyed it. He teaches through telling stories, but they are very relevant and help you see the bigger picture of the concept! there is a textbook but its not needed IF you go to class. He's also pretty funny in my opinion. Def recommend.

Very funny haha guy. He loves his stories, but there is so much value in them. Just go to the lectures and you'll be fine. People getting bad grades is because they didn't attend lectures. TAKE HIM!!!!

I liked this professor, his lectures are easy but even though his classes are not attendance mandatory, i highly recommend going to his class because they would not be any announcement about a test in d2l or email, he announces it in class, and the tests are in person. and he would not let you retake anything.

If you like learning through story telling, professor Randy is the one for you. His story based lectures tie in with the exams and your homework so take notes and pay attention and you should do well.

Don't get the textbook, you'll never need it.
Go to class, lectures are great. He's super entertaining, and answers questions.
Tests based entirely of lectures, there's only 2 of them.
Homework is easy, just google the answers. or collaborate with classmates.
Class is done a month before finals, and he's great with accommodations!

Professor Goodwin is one of the best professors I've had. He teaches based on personal life stories which makes the material easy to pick up. The homework is very easy and from the book and if you attend the lectures you will have no problems with the tests. He is a very funny guy and provided the least stressful class I have taken.

All of his lectures are story based. There aren't really any notes you need to take. There are 7 HW assignments that he tells you to share answers with others in the class to get 100%. You can pass based on online HW. 2 tests 60 points total. He is super funny and entertaining to go to class which is a nice switch from other profs. Tests are mid.
Story-based lectures that are easy to follow if that floats your boat. 3 easy hws and 3 easy test. If you do not learn from stories I recommend taking someone else, otherwise take him.

Dr. Goodwin is extremely knowledgeable in Economics. His lectures are story-based and don't require many notes. You need to listen to his lectures, turn homework in on time, and attend class. Attendance isn't mandatory, but helpful on the homework and tests. Your grade is based on 3 online homework grades and 3 in-person tests. He's very funny.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: For the online course you have to watch his lectures by a certain day and time (cutoff time was 8PM which is ridiculous to me) otherwise you are not allowed to take the exam. If that wasn't bad enough, the course was only scheduled around 3 exams and 3 hw assignments. I reccomend  professor if you don't want to deal with these antics.

Loved hearing Randy's stories that correlated to the content however this became difficult and boring... maybe read the textbook and that will help but I personally don't recommend if you're looking for straight forwardness. also test are paper and in person.

If you need a professor that uses power points,resources through D2L,or provides help outside of class then I would NOT taken him. He teaches through like life stories and it was extremely confusing to me and made it hard to take notes. There are 5 homework assignments and 2 tests but I was learning nothing so I had to drop this class mid semester.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: 5 homework assignments and 2 tests all semester and our lowest homework was dropped. He is very energetic during lectures but tests were still a little hard. I made a C on both tests but still finished the course with a B!

Randy was hilarious and made the lectures exciting. There were 2 in person tests but all the homework was online. There were only 5 homework assignments the whole semester and they were open note. Would def take him.

6 tests the whole semester and he drops 1. NGL his tests are pretty hard if u don't understand ECON. I never missed a class and I passed his class with a C. He's a GREAT professor, the problem is how his tests are formatted. Sometimes, it doesn't make sense. His tests are all open note tho. Take him, you'll learn a lot, and show up to class!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: 4 tests that are open note, show up to class and listen and you'll do well!

I had his class as a dual enrollment student and it was completely online. Everything was open note and you just had to watch his lectures and take notes on them. He was very entertaining and he explains the content in a way that is very easy to understand with lots of examples.

Funniest professor I've ever had. You MUST watch his lectures, or you cannot take the exams. 8 tests no lockdown and one exam (optional). Tests are tricky but every single question can be found in his lectures. Lectures take up about an hour a week with no additional homework/studying. Any question you have receive a reply back within hours.

His tests are somewhat challenging but do not have lockdown browser. It is hard to study for the test because he does not give example questions. YOU MUST WATCH HIS LECTURES! If you do not, you will not be able to take your exam. He also drops your lowest quiz grade. If you miss a test for ANY reason, it will be a zero, then be dropped.
The worse. Made the class hard for no reason.

He is very strict. If you don't watch his lecture videos by the due date than you can't take the exam. He does not accommodate you for any health, work, or family matters. Exams are open for only 12 hours, so plan ahead. There are 8 tests and a final. The test questions are confusing and worded weirdly. I studied and still managed to barely pass.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I'm sure Randy doesn't need another positive review, but here's one anyways. This class is difficult, but an A is easily attainable. Randy is a top notch econ professor, and a truly interesting individual. If you'd like to learn about how money works, take Randy's class. I hope to take more during my time at Coles.

The people from my class must have been lazy or weren't studying correctly. We could get the material from online lectures or go to his in-class lectures. All you have to do is listen and take notes. The questions on the test aren't word for word what he says in the lecture, they are made for you to actually think. No lockdown on his test.
DO NOT TAKE! Everyone failed the final and had low grades for the class. There is no curve as well.

Please do everything you can to avoid this class. The first day we all were so hopeful because he said it was easy and took all of our suggestions for extra points and an optional final. He even said not to get the textbook and not to come to class unless we had questions. Lecture videos did not help at all, and very not worth it.
His tests are incredibly difficult. the study guides barely help with the tests. Also, there is no extra credit given or other grades besides tests.

I took Randy for microeconomics this semester and it was the most impossible class I have taken so far. Grade is based on six tests ( five throughout the semester and then a cumulative final). He recorded all the lectures (in a dark room so its just his voice and silhouette) but the information was nothing like the tests. Funny guy, bad professor.

AVOID. Class is based on 5 tests and a final. He told us not to get the book, so we relied on his lecture videos for the first test (DIDN'T help). Everyone had to buy the book and teach themselves. When asked for extra credit since most people were failing his tests, he told us no because "we do not show up to class" even though he told us not to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Please do not take this Professor, his class at first seemed like an Easy A but it is not. All his lecture videos, his in-class lectures are the same, and not helpful. You will need to be good at micro already and you found it easy, take this class if not, Avoid it. Grades are only tests, online, non-proctored, his tests are created by him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: There's no homework or extra classwork. You only have to do tests and finals. But he doesn't even give students the chance to see what questions they answered incorrectly. What's the point of taking tests if students can't see what they did wrong on the tests. You're basically going through the whole course blind.

Professor Goodwin, as an economics professor, is great for students like me who really struggle in mathematics as his course content is easy to grasp. However, he can come off as a bit too harsh in tone when he speaks sometimes. Additionally, his test dates are clearly laid out in the syllabus, but don't forget them as he doesn't accept excuses!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: 5 tests and Final. Not lockdown. Easy.

Entertaining lectures. He is grounded and good at simplifying complex concepts. Not much course work only four tests. He doesn't use D2L so go to class because the test questions come from his lecture and the review. Take good notes. He is really good at letting you know what will be on the test.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Hilarious

comment: I love economics so I ended with a 100 in his class. I loved going to his lectures and he was probably my favorite professor I have ever taken. I am upset the virus meant I only got to go for half the semester but I am so glad I took him. Gives 4 extra points on each test, gives good study guides, he is so funny and teaches very well.

one of my favorite professors. he's hilarious and makes lectures worth going to. attendance is not mandatory but the tests are based on the specific things he talks about in class so I definitely recommend going. graded by 3 tests + optional final and he gives 4 bonus points on each test.

Best professor i've ever had, hoping to take him again for 2200. he connects the unit topics with stories to help you learn the content better and his stories are hilarious so you actually pay attention and don't fall asleep. not sure why people are saying avoid, take this man! he is nice and wants you to pass

Great professor. Took Econ 2100 before 1000 and his class was still easy. He teaches by telling stories and his tests are made up of those examples. He also gives out a study guide before the test that helps. Very funny guy that likes teaching Econ. It's easy to get an A if you actually go to class and do the study guide.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: only 4 tests, drops one. gives out study guides but they're not really like the tests. I WOULD AVOID
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: AVOID

Mr. Goodwin is hilarious and definitely knows his stuff. ONLY 3 tests, no other assignments. Attendance isn't mandatory but if you don't show up you won't understand the material as well. He goes through material fast sometimes so I was reliant on Youtube for most of it. His tests were okay, I had to study a lot to understand it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: He's fun but if you dont understand it you're just going to be confused all semester. Don't take 2200 before you take econ 1000.

Randy is by far the best professor I've ever had. His lectures are hilarious and he tells stories that help you remember the content. If you don't go to class it's hard to pass because he doesn't use a book and the only grades are tests, but it's more than worth it to show up for the lectures.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Hilarious

comment: 3 tests and an optional final (only 3 of those grades count). Attendance isn't mandatory and you can choose to buy the textbook and teach yourself. I didn't find his tests too hard, but some did. It really depends on how much you remember from high school econ. Overall he's a funny guy and his lectures teach you everything you need to know.
If you take him you will not regret it. Amazing lectures. I will be taking him for Econ 2200 and Im very excited about this!!! :)
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Hilarious

comment: Overall he is a cool guy, but as a professor, not so much. You have 4 tests and THAT IS IT. If you approach him, he does not offer much help and always thinks that the material is "easy" and some people would feel stupid because he acts like you should know everything. Tests can be extremely difficult especially test 2. Good luck.

He is hilarious and makes class enjoyable. He gives a lot of real life scenarios which makes it easier to connect with the material. He drops the lowest test grade. I will be taking him for Econ 2200.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: It's almost impossible to not make an A in this class if you record his lectures and study your notes. Randy tells such interesting stories that help you learn and retain the info. No need for the textbook, the tests are only over what he says, which is why he encourages you record him. Extremely easy class. TAKE HIM. You can exempt the final

Entertaining during lectures, to say the least. Very easy to understand and digest the concepts covered in class thanks to his stories he tells. Makes going to class interesting which many professors lack. Would recommend to anyone taking economics classes.

He is hands down my favorite professor I have taken. He has great stories that really connect the material. There's no mandatory attendance and the only grades are 4 tests (Best of 3). If you go to all of the lectures and take even minimal notes, you are guaranteed an A. He gives great review packs that are basically the test.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: Most entertaining professor I have had since I have been in college. Makes class fun. Class is very test heavy with 3 tests making up your grade. Go to class and study hard and you will most likely make an A
If you like economics, TAKE HIM!!!! He's one of my absolute favorites! You won't regret it.
